place.name: SEDGEFORD
place.gazetteerText: SEDGEFORD, a parish, with a village and a hamlet, in Docking district, Norfolk; on the West Norfolk Junction railway, 12½ miles N N E of Lynn. It has a station on the railway, and a post-office under Lynn. Acres, 4, 180. Real property, £5, 268. Pop., 742. Houses, 158. S. Hall belongs to F. Rolfe, Esq., and is occupied by J. W. Howlett, Esq. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Norwich. Value, £330.* Patrons, the Dean and Chapter of Norwich. The church was restored in 1842. There are Wesleyan, P. Methodist, and NewMethodist chapels, a national school, a circulating library, and charities £36. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
